course.title: Human Being and the Sacred in the History of the West
course.meeting_text: M., W., (F.), at 11, and a weekly section to be arranged.
course.description: A culture's understanding of what it is to be human interacts with its understanding of what is sacred. Great works of art in the culture typically reflect or articulate these notions. This course will explore the themes of human being and the sacred as they are manifested in some of the greatest works in the history of the West. Readings chosen from among Homer, Aeschylus, Virgil, the New Testament, Augustine, Dante, Luther, Pascal, Kant, Melville, and others.
course.notes: This course fulfills the requirement that one of the eight General Education courses also engage substantially with Study of the Past.
